27BC3B56285443B5824287B7D068260F.description: Students are encouraged to participate in extended learning experiences such as career and technical student organizations and other leadership or extracurricular organizations.

C5AB82FEA68E4EC3BAB1F30591060CA8.description: Careers in fashion span all aspects of the textile and apparel industries. Within this context, in addition to developing technical knowledge and skills needed for success in the Arts, Audio/Video Technology, and Communications Career Cluster, students will be expected to develop an understanding of the fashion industry with an emphasis on design and construction.

DA026738D30A4AC3BDF0BE280A28BAA4.description: The Arts, Audio/Video Technology, and Communications Career Cluster focuses on careers in designing, producing, exhibiting, performing, writing, and publishing multimedia content, including visual and performing arts and design, journalism, and entertainment services.

61AC84167A3F4ACAA97AB174249A389C.description: Career and technical education instruction provides content aligned with challenging academic standards and relevant technical knowledge and skills for students to further their education and succeed in current or emerging professions.

872D0CF2E1F64773B370B097C2E7EF79.description: General requirements. This course is recommended for students in Grades 10-12. Recommended prerequisite: Principles of Arts, Audio/Video Technology, and Communications. Recommended corequisite: Fashion Design I Lab. Students shall be awarded one credit for successful completion of this course.
